reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Driving up to the Inn I said oh crap what did I get myself into. I decided to give the place a chance. I quickly learned that looks are very deceiving. The room was small but so cozy, Very Very beautiful room. The managers David and Hayley, were very nice and friendly, they made me feel like they had known me for years. The hotel was very quiet and warm.
reviews.title: Best hideaway hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff was very friendly and accomidating to my needs. This is the one hotel that I will stay at in bodega bay.
reviews.title: Nice place, nice welcome.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A nice place to stay in Bodega Bay considering its price. Quiet at night when traffic slowed down. Bathroom very clean, room not so much. Nice continental breakfast proposed in the lobby which we enjoyed on our small terrace overlooking the bay (room N°14).
reviews.title: Terrific value in a great location.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room was very nice.Out on the front porch we could have coffee or wine,with a partial view of the bay. Several feet away on the lawn were lawn chairs.Also surrounding you were many beautiful flowers. The Inn is clean and well maintained. The management team of Hayley and her husband David were very gracious.They could not do enough for you. Their is no restaraunt on site,they directed us to some very nice places to dine Our stay was three nights.The front office is open 9AM to 9PM. They have a small lobby where in the morning they have on display an assortment of cakes ,bagels bread,hard boiled eggs,cereal and gourmet coffee. The room rates are the best you can find at the Bay..By no means is this the Ritz Carlton but is was very enjoyable and I would definitely.reccomend to all.
reviews.title: Extraordinary hospitality

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009
reviews.text: This inn was full when we arrived on a windy evening.
reviews.title: A place to sleep. Just the basics.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked our room with a gift certificate to stay at the Harbor Cottage ("value" of $150-$175). A couple weeks later, we got a call saying that they had double booked, and we would be staying at the Harbor House instead. Of course, this was ok, as it was an upgrade. Unfortunately, the evening before we set out to Bodega Bay, we got another call saying they had to move us again, this time to Pelican House. They assured us that it was the same value, which we assumed was "Pelican 2." When we arrived, we learned that in fact they had downgraded us, and placed us in "Pelican 1" which was listed as a cost of $135. No apologies on their part. When we went to our room, it had a musty smell... and it was really nothing to write home about. The room was separated from "Pelican 2" with a paper thin wall. We tried to watch a movie that night, but the DVD player didn't work correctly (we played the DVD when we got home and it worked fine). At about midnight or so, the power went off completely, and stayed off until we checked out. When we went to complain the morning about having been downgraded from a private cottage to a house that had very little privacy, the manager was quite rude to us and tried to justify her actions by saying that we hadn't complained when we had been "upgraded" (funny, because I don't consider it an upgrade when we don't have a choice in the matter). Further, no apologies or politeness about the lack of power was offered. Basically, we found the staff to be incredibly rude, and unprofessional, and the room to be very plain, and far overpriced. What would have been an otherwise very nice trip to the area, and a lovely gift in the form of a stay at a cottage, was ruined by a staff that was rude and dishonest.
reviews.title: Don't even think about it

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The woman that owns and runs the inn, couldn't have been nicer! She was warm and welcoming, and worked to help me set something up last minute for my boyfriend and I. We wanted to drive up from SF just for a quick over night trip on a budget and this was perfect! She greeted us when we arrived along with her adorable doggie, and had turned the lights and heat on in our room so it was nice and toasty once we got inside from the chilly evening.
reviews.title: Cozy little spot, great value!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled on business
reviews.text: The room was cozy and clean, just what we needed for a nice little overnight stay. Simple, clean bathroom with fresh fluffy towels. Beautiful little property with a splendid view of the harbor, and its right there off Highway 1. In the morning the owner had a fantastic little set up of breakfast treats and morning beverages. Well worth the price! I would come back in a heartbeat!
reviews.title: It was ok. Nothing special

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: Initial booking was through Inn owner, Karen who was very pleasant and helpful. We were attending a wedding in a nearby town and it was suggested we stay at Bodega Bay. There were not a lot of options as it's a very small place. We chose the Bodega Harbour Inn for three nights and ended up getting a small two bedroom bungalow (the Harbour House) with an ocean view and a hot tub outside. The grounds and building are well-maintained. This is an older building and some updating has been done. Housecleaning was ok, but there was a smell of possibly cat or dog urine when we arrived. We aired the house out upon arrival and kept the windows open during the night.
reviews.title: Worst motel room ever...

likes.disliked: — Cleanliness of room and lack of ammenities

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: We had family staying in town as well at other locations so it was important for us to keep in contact with them. There was no phone number listed on the phone for the Harbour House and we don't have a cell phone as where we live, there is no service. We could call out, but no one could call us. I stopped by the Inn office the next morning to obtain the phone number and was advised that the phones are being removed next week and she no longer had the phone number for that house. She said that if someone needed to reach us, they could call the Inn and she would walk a message down to us, a block away. (They have limited office hours and when we arrived at 7:30PM, the office was closed so I knew this could be a problem). We also asked for an additional key as they would be times where hubby and I would be going in different directions. She fumbled around and eventually found a key, which turned out later was a completely different kind of key so would not work anyways.
reviews.title: An Inn for the families comfort and service

likes.liked: — The privacy and accomidation met our needs perfectly and with comfort.
likes.disliked: — We had to leave the inn to find reseraunts, alltho they were very close and very good.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Clean Room at a fair price, Water Tower room very reasonably priced, small but adequate for an overnight "sleeper".
reviews.title: Good choice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010
reviews.text: Not expensive either, but they kind of know the market, and there aren't a ton of local choices. But the staff were friendly to us, and helpful with tourist info. The breakfast is simple, but it gets you going, and they make a good cup of coffee. The view is across a road to the harbor, and that was a bit of a disappointment, but it's a decent place to stay, and you'll be happy with it as a one-night hangout.
reviews.title: Not cheap, but good

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled solo
reviews.text: I stayed by myself for one night, so it didn't matter that the room was small. The blinds were broken, and the manager replaced them right away. The management was very friendly and accommodating. Room was very clean and fresh though the bed wasn't the most comfortable, but ok. Good value.
reviews.title: Small rooms but great value for the area

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Do not count on what you reserve.
reviews.title: Nice place, new management not people friendly

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled solo
reviews.text: Managemment is not very accommodating.
reviews.title: Always a pleasure to get away from it all for an overnight stay.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We found this place by a little sign along the road-it is gray cute and cozy and the owners are great people we stayed in room 8 not huge bot small you could hear the fog horn at night- waked to the sandpiper for breakfast and dinner
reviews.title: A hidden jem

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was clean small t.v. and bathroom but a great deal and nice beds
reviews.title: was the worst experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The manager Hayley was non resposive when we complained of the bathroom being dirty.
reviews.title: Great!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: She also was rude when we asked for some clean sheets which were stained.
reviews.title: Good Value or the area

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled with friends
reviews.text: We have stayed at the Bodega Harbor Inn twice now and each time has been a great experience. Haley and David are great hosts and very accommodating. They go out of their way to make our stay pleasurable. Great view from the grass area for beautiful sunsets.
reviews.title: absolutely wonderful
